facts: Psychological studies show humans derive meaning from finite time horizons and mortality awareness
The hedonic treadmill phenomenon demonstrates that humans adapt to positive changes, returning to baseline happiness levels
Social bonds are strengthened by shared mortality and generational succession
Historical and literary analysis consistently portrays immortal beings as suffering from ennui, detachment, and loss of purpose

citations.reference: Bernard Williams (1973), Problems of the Self

claim.statement: Immortality constitutes a psychological curse because it eliminates the temporal scarcity that gives human life meaning and purpose
